title: Who played the bass guitar for the Beatles? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sir paul McCartney was the Beatles bass player. He also played piano and lead and rhythm guitar on a number of tracks as well. John Lennon played bass on some tracks when doing live takes and sir Paul was busy playing piano(lennon also played piano on a number of beatles tracks). They were skilled musicians in general and had arguably the greatest ever song writing partnership in lennon/McCartney. George Harrison was also a world class songwriter in his own right

Paul McCartney played bass for the Beatles when they played live and on nearly all of their recordings. Early on in the Beatles (before they signed a record contract) they had a friend of John's play bass, Stu Sutcliffe. He died at a young age and at that time John, George and Paul played guitar. One of them had to take on the bass. George was considered the best guitarist and John was the leader at that time and said he wouldn't play bass. That left the bass to Paul.
